results.title: Winter light = Nattvardsgarterna
results.brief_description: The second film in his trilogy on faith, “Winter light” springs from Bergman’s desire to define Man’s relation to God - if He exists. A village pastor, unloved and empty of faith, reveals his bitter failure to offer spiritual consolation to his flock. Sombre and poignant, the film sketches a world of half-empty churches - but a world not entirely without hope in God’s universe. The story brings together four personalities in a shared quest for siritual reassurance. A susceptible and disillusioned fisherman (Max von Sydow) is urged by his wife (Gunnel Lindboim) to seek solace from his local priest (Gunnar Bjornstrand). However the priest is struggling to regain his own belief - a tragic and intimately depicted conflict, in which he is eventually supported by the cynical resilience of the local schoolmistress (Ingrid Thulin). Swedish language with English subtitles.

results.title: Wild strawberries
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: Wild Strawberries is justifiably considered a classic Ingmar Bergman film. Isak Borg (Victor Sjostrom) is 78 and about to be honoured by the University of Lund for his services to medicine. He decides to drive to Lund with his daughter-in-law Marianne (Ingrid Thulin). The film follows the events of the day as he remembers scenes from the past, has bouts of troubling dreams, and meets up with a group of young travellers. Victor Sjostrom is marvelous as the rigid professor who is touched by the warmth of the people who he encounters on this pivotal day. This edition comes with Ingmar Bergman’s screenplay, which gives a fascinating insight into Bergman’s narrative skills, and includes a run-down of the cutting continuity for those interested in the techniques of film-making. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Smiles of a summer night
results.brief_description: This film marked a milestone in Bergman’s career and his success with international audiences allowed him this foray into romantic comedy. Forming the basis for Stephen Sondheim’s musical ‘ A Little night music’, this is the story of a middle-aged lawyer, his inexperienced young wife and her step-so, who are all invited to spend the weekend at the country mansion of a beautiful actress, the lawyer’s ex-mistress. During the course of the weekend three couples meet, exchange partners and provide some lively comedic action, illustrating Bergman’s sardonic attitude towards the vagaries of love. Behind the scintillating and witty approach to this charming period comedy of manners lie the illusions and pretensions of the haute bourgeois which Bergman cleverly illistrates with his collection of fickle husbands and scheming women.

results.title: Images: my life in film (Text)
results.brief_description: This book was written by Ingmar Bergman. To write it he rescreened all of his films, many not seen since their release. He recounts the making of the films and explores the themes that bind them together, the preoccupations, the anguish, the conflicts. He comments unsurprisingly on his successes as well as his perceived failures. This text is an eloquent and indispensable companion to Bergman’s films.

results.title: Mrs. Doubtfire (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Chris Columbus, Mark Radcliffe, Robin Williams, Masha Williams and Blue Wolf
results.brief_description: How far would an ordinary father go to spend time with his children? Daniel Hillard (Robin Williams) is no ordinary father, so when he learns his ex-wife (Sally Field) needs a housekeeper, he applies for the job. With the perfect wig, a little makeup and a dress for all occasions, he becomes Mrs. Doubtfire, a devoted British housekeeper who is hired on the spot. Outrageous, hilarious and often touching, Robin Williams makes this box-office hit a film to be watched again and again.

results.title: The Seventh seal
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: Ingmar Bergman’s “Seventh seal” deserves its reputation as a benchmark in the lexicon of modern cinema. With striking imagery, captivating characters and deep philosophical arguments Bergman weaves a rich tapestry as only a master can. Set in the middle ages in the midst of the plague, Antonius Block (Max Von Sydow) is a knight returning from the crusades. When Death (Bengt Ekerot) appears before him he suggests a game of chess to forestall his fate. He travels to his home with an assortment of characters, including his atheist squire Jons (Gunnar Bjornstrand) and a troupe of travelling players. Despite it’s metaphysical content “The Seventh Seal” also includes a heavy dose of Scandinavian humour. In Swedish with english subtitles.

results.title: Long live the lady! = Lunga vita alla signora!
results.creator_credit: Giampietro Bonamigo, Artificial Eye, RAIUNO, Cinemaundici and Ermanno Olmi
results.brief_description: Ermanno Olmi’s “Lunga Vita alla signora!” will be a delightful film for anyone working in the hospitality industry. Six young hospitality trainees are chosen to assist with a banquet in honour of a mysterious old lady. The great day does not unfold as they expected. Winner of the Silver Lion at the 1987 Venice Film Festival. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: A Dog of Flanders
results.creator_credit: James B. Clark, Robert B Radnitz, Associated producers, TCF and DeLuxe Cinemascope
results.brief_description: 12 year old Nello lives with his grandfather near Antwerp. They manage to eke a living by delivering milk into the city. Nello dreams of becoming a famous artist like Ruebens and is able to satisfy his interest by befriending a painter. One day while returning from a delivery Nello discovers a dog, left for dead in the bushes. They take him home and restore his health. The owner soon turns up to reclaim his dog, fortunately he is unsuccessful. This is only the start to Nello’s troubles as his grandfather dies, leaving Nello without enough money to look after himself, let alone the dog. A touching story that will appeal to the whole family. Starring David Ladd, Donald Crisp and Theodore Bikel. Based on the novel by Ouida.

results.title: Horses
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basics to Eventing”.
Horse riding and good horsemanship in three parts. Pt. 1: “The Ten Commandments” gives an introduction to the basics of good riding. Pt. 2: “Learning to Jump” shows the way in which horses and riders are trained for jumping in the South Australian Police Force Mounted Division. Pt. 3: “The Cross-Country Event” focuses on differing aspects of horsemanship from handling to competition.

results.title: Kolya
results.creator_credit: Jan Sverak, Eric Abraham, Pandora Cinema, Ceska televize, Portobello Pictures and Biograf Jan Sverak
results.brief_description: Louka is a middle-aged Czech who loves women, hates the idea of commitment and owes more money than he can earn playing the cello in a funeral orchestra. When a friend suggests he make a little ‘easy money’ by entering into an arranged marriage, with a Russian woman seeking citizenship, Louka reluctantly agrees. But it’s a decision that will throw his life into chaos…and change it forever. When the marriage is completed his new ‘wife’ is on the first plane to Germany leaving behind her five year old son for Louka to care for. So now this confirmed bachelor must become a father.. this grumpy old man and an innocent kid must learn to live together, even though they don’t speak the same language. This is a funny, touching and unforgettable story that will touch your heart. Winner of the Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. Contains Czech and Russian language with English subtitles.
